body: Seems like a valid suggestion. Thanks!

I have not looked closely if this is already covered, but I guess this could also be used for a custom naming scheme. I'm looking at this to use with Hugo, and we have made up some names to make it easier for the users to understand (i386 => 32-bit etc.).

@bep some custom naming is available since [v0.2.9](https://github.com/goreleaser/releaser/releases/tag/v0.2.9), but not yet what you're asking.

I'll think in a way of doing what you're asking, probably something like:

```yml
archive:
  translations:
    linux: Linux
    i386: 32bit
    # etc
```

Not sure about the `translations` as name nor about the syntax itself... but seems like an ok way of doing this...

what do you think?

>what do you think?

"translations" is not a very good term -- maybe just "replacements", but I agree in general: As list of old/new replacement pairs.

milestone.title: v1.0.0
milestone.description: Intended to be the first stable solution, with most of the features implemented.

body: @bep version 0.3.0 supports the replacements as discussed. :)
Guys, you slightly highjacked my original feature request. how about the OP? :)
@titpetric the post and pre-build hook are still a valid feature I guess..

What do you think about adding a `before` and `after` option to the `build` section?
Each of them would be a string which is evaluated as shell input. 
This way you could do some small one-line logic or you could call another executable for more complicated tasks.
Yes, I was thinking about doing just that ðŸ˜€

issue.title: added hooks support
issue.body:
add support for pre and post hooks on build pipe

closes #13
